title: Council owned football pitches FOI request

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please can you help me out with the following FOI request:
How many council owned, public football pitches do you currently operate (latest figures available)
How many council owned, public football pitches were sold, or closed, from the financial year 2017/2018 to the present date?
Yours faithfully,
Jon Parker-Dean

Dear Jon Parker-Dean,
Thank you for your request for information relating to council owned
football pitches which we received on 20/07/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 17/08/2023. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,

Dear Jon Parker-Dean,
Thank you for your request for information relating to council owned
football pitches which we received on 20/07/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
How many council owned, public football pitches do you currently operate
(latest figures available)
• Parks senior football pitches currently available for hire: 39
• Parks junior football pitches currently available for hire: 67
• Pitches with an allocated team or teams for the 2023/24 season:
◦ Senior: 32
◦ Junior: 57
How many council owned, public football pitches were sold, or closed, from
the financial year 2017/2018 to the present date?
No pitches have been sold. The Parks and Countryside service, at times,
‘set aside’ pitches which are no longer in use due to demand, but these
can be brought back into use if demand and finances are there. Since 2017,
we have set aside 8 pitches.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
